org.bluez.v4
Interface Adapter

All Superinterfaces:
Adapter, DBusInterface, DBusProperties.PropertiesAccess
public interface Adapter
extends Adapter, DBusProperties.PropertiesAccess

BlueZ V4 D-Bus Adapter API Adapter hierarchy

Service org.bluez

Interface org.bluez.Adapter

Object path [variable prefix]/{hci0,hci1,...}

Created base on D-Bus API description for BlueZ. bluez-4.32/doc/adapter-api.txt

Method Detail

RequestSession

void RequestSession()
                    throws Error.Rejected
This method will request a client session that provides operational Bluetooth. A possible mode change must be confirmed by the user via the agent.

Throws:
Error.Rejected

ReleaseSession

void ReleaseSession()
                    throws Error.DoesNotExist
Release a previous requested session.

Throws:
Error.DoesNotExist

StartDiscovery

void StartDiscovery()
                    throws Error.NotReady,
                           Error.Failed
This method starts the device discovery session. This includes an inquiry procedure and remote device name resolving. Use StopDiscovery to release the sessions acquired. This process will start emitting DeviceFound and PropertyChanged "Discovering" signals.

Throws:
Error.NotReady
Error.Failed

StopDiscovery

void StopDiscovery()
                   throws Error.NotReady,
                          Error.Failed,
                          Error.NotAuthorized
This method will cancel any previous StartDiscovery transaction. Note that a discovery procedure is shared between all discovery sessions thus calling StopDiscovery will only release a single session.

Throws:
Error.NotReady
Error.Failed
Error.NotAuthorized

FindDevice

Path FindDevice(java.lang.String address)
                throws Error.DoesNotExist,
                       Error.InvalidArguments
Returns the object path of device for given address. The device object needs to be first created via CreateDevice or CreatePairedDevice.

Throws:
Error.DoesNotExist
Error.InvalidArguments

ListDevices

Path[] ListDevices()
                   throws Error.InvalidArguments,
                          Error.Failed,
                          Error.OutOfMemory
Returns list of device object paths.

Throws:
Error.InvalidArguments
Error.Failed
Error.OutOfMemory

CreateDevice

Path CreateDevice(java.lang.String address)
                  throws Error.InvalidArguments,
                         Error.Failed
Creates a new object path for a remote device. This method will connect to the remote device and retrieve all SDP records. If the object for the remote device already exists this method will fail.

Throws:
Error.InvalidArguments
Error.Failed

CreatePairedDevice

Path CreatePairedDevice(java.lang.String address,
                        Path agent,
                        java.lang.String capability)
                        throws Error.InvalidArguments,
                               Error.Failed
Creates a new object path for a remote device. This method will connect to the remote device and retrieve all SDP records and then initiate the pairing. If previously CreateDevice was used successfully, this method will only initiate the pairing. Compared to CreateDevice this method will fail if the pairing already exists, but not if the object path already has been created. This allows applications to use CreateDevice first and the if needed use CreatePairedDevice to initiate pairing. The agent object path is assumed to reside within the process (D-Bus connection instance) that calls this method. No separate registration procedure is needed for it and it gets automatically released once the pairing operation is complete. The capability parameter is the same as for the RegisterAgent method.

Throws:
Error.InvalidArguments
Error.Failed

CancelDeviceCreation

void CancelDeviceCreation(java.lang.String address)
                          throws Error.InvalidArguments,
                                 Error.NotInProgress
Aborts either a CreateDevice call or a CreatePairedDevice call.

Throws:
Error.InvalidArguments
Error.NotInProgress

RemoveDevice

void RemoveDevice(Path device)
                  throws Error.InvalidArguments,
                         Error.Failed
This removes the remote device object at the given path. It will remove also the pairing information.

Throws:
Error.InvalidArguments
Error.Failed

RegisterAgent

void RegisterAgent(Path agent,
                   java.lang.String capability)
                   throws Error.InvalidArguments,
                          Error.AlreadyExists
This registers the adapter wide agent. The object path defines the path the of the agent that will be called when user input is needed. If an application disconnects from the bus all of its registered agents will be removed. The capability parameter can have the values "DisplayOnly", "DisplayYesNo", "KeyboardOnly" and "NoInputNoOutput" which reflects the input and output capabilities of the agent. If an empty string is used it will fallback to "DisplayYesNo".

Throws:
Error.InvalidArguments
Error.AlreadyExists

UnregisterAgent

void UnregisterAgent(Path agent)
                     throws Error.DoesNotExist
This unregisters the agent that has been previously registered. The object path parameter must match the same value that has been used on registration.

Throws:
Error.DoesNotExist
